xs:annotation.xs:documentation: The year for a reported school session.
The school that managed or administered the activity.
The school that managed or administered the activity.
The date that the student, school, and school district fulfills the listed activities described within the IEP.
The date when a student is identified by a school or school district as being eligible for special education services.
The year, month and day on which the person began to participate in a program.
The year, month and day on which the person ceased to participate in a program.
The reason children who were in special education at the start of the reporting period, but were not in special education at the end of the reporting period.
An indication of whether a person is classified as disabled under the American's with Disability Act (ADA).
Individuals with disabilities who are being provided with related aids and services under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
The major or overriding disability condition that best describes a person's impairment.
The ratio between the hours of work expected in a special education capacity and the hours of work normally expected in a full-time placement in the same setting.

A person having intellectual disability; hearing impairment, including deafness; speech or language impairment; visual impairment, including blindness; serious emotional disturbance (hereafter referred to as emotional disturbance); orthopedic impairment; autism; traumatic brain injury; developmental delay; other health impairment; specific learning disability; deaf-blindness; or multiple disabilities and who, by reason thereof, receive special education and related services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) according to an Individualized Education Program (IEP), Individual Family Service Plan (IFSP), or service plan.

xs:appinfo.elementName: IDEA Educational Environment For Early Childhood

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: The setting in which children ages 6 through 21, receive special education and related services.

xs:appinfo.elementName: IDEA Educational Environment For School Age

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: A representation or characterization of the setting in which children ages 6 through 21, receive special education and related services.

Type of related or ancillary services provided to a person or a group of persons within the formal educational system or offered by an outside agency which provides non-instructional services to support the general welfare of students. This includes physical and emotional health, the ability to select an appropriate course of study, admission to appropriate educational programs, and the ability to adjust to and remain in school through the completion of programs. In serving a student with an identified disability, related services include developmental, corrective, or supportive services required to ensure that the person benefits from special education.

A representation or characterization of the related or ancillary services provided to a person or a group of persons within the formal educational system or offered by an outside agency which provides non-instructional services to support the general welfare of students. This includes physical and emotional health, the ability to select an appropriate course of study, admission to appropriate educational programs, and the ability to adjust to and remain in school through the completion of programs. In serving a student with an identified disability, related services include developmental, corrective, or supportive services required to ensure that the person benefits from special education.
The organization that is supplying the money to provide the service to the student.
A representation or characterization of the organizaiton that is supplying the money to provide the service to the student and why it is being provided.

The name of the organization that is supplying the necessary instructional materials and personnel to deliver the service to the student. Use code "ServiceProvider" when referring to CEDS element 0011156

The primary contact phone number for the organization that is supplying the necessary instructional materials and personnel to deliver the service to the student. Uses code "Administrative" when referring to CEDS element 000167 and "Yes" when referring to CEDS element 000219.

xs:appinfo.elementName: Individualized Program Inclusion Minutes Per Week

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: The number of minutes per week that a student with disabilities is served in a special education setting separate from his or her non-disabled peers.

xs:appinfo.elementName: Individualized Program Non-inclusion Minutes Per Week

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: The number of minutes per week that a student with disabilities is served in a regular classroom with his or her non-disabled peers.
